content.description: Beaker 1 and beaker 2 each contain <math alttext="100.0 milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mn>100.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mL</mi></math> of saturated <math alttext="C u S O 4, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CuSO</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> and <math alttext="25.0 grams" overflow="scroll"><mn>25.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> of undissolved <math alttext="C u S O 4, solid" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CuSO</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>. A <math alttext="50.0 milliliters" overflow="scroll"> <mn>50.0</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mtext>mL</mtext> </math> sample of distilled water is added to beaker 2, the contents are stirred for several minutes, and <math alttext="C u S O 4, solid" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CuSO</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> is observed at the bottom of the beaker.
content.question: After stirring, which of the following is true about the contents of the beakers? (Assume temperature remains constant.)

choices.label: The concentration of <math alttext="C u S O 4, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CuSO</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> in beaker 2 is less than in beaker 1.

The concentration of <math alttext="C u S O 4, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CuSO</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> in beaker 2 is greater than in beaker 1.

The mass of undissolved <math alttext="C u S O 4, solid" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CuSO</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> in beaker 2 is less than in beaker 1.

The mass of undissolved <math alttext="C u S O 4, solid" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CuSO</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> in beaker 2 is greater than in beaker 1.

content.answer: The mass of undissolved <math alttext="C u S O 4, solid" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CuSO</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> in beaker 2 is less than in beaker 1.

skill.text: 2.B: Formulate a hypothesis or predict the results of an experiment.
